name: No-Cream Pasta Primavera
author: amanda1432
summary: Spring veggies benefit from a quick roasting in olive oil and herbs before being tossed with penne. No cream here, just the fresh flavors of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and lemon. A beautiful dish.
ingredients: ½  red bell peppers, cut into matchsticks
1 cup fresh green beans, trimmed and cut into 1 inch pieces
5 spears asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1 inch pieces
¼ teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper
¼ large yellow onion, thinly sliced
⅓ cup chopped fresh basil leaves
directions: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Add penne pasta and cook until tender yet firm to the bite, 10 to 12 minutes; drain
Toss squash, zucchini, carrot, red bell pepper, tomatoes, green beans, and asparagus together in a bowl with 2 tablespoons olive oil, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and Italian seasoning
Arrange vegetables on the lined baking sheet
Roast vegetables in preheated oven until tender, about 15 minutes
Heat remaining olive oil and butter in a large skillet
Cook onion and garlic in hot oil until tender, 5 to 7 minutes
Mix cooked pasta, lemon zest, basil, parsley, and balsamic vinegar into the onion mixture
Gently toss and cook until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes
Remove from heat and transfer to a large bowl
Toss with roasted vegetables and sprinkle with Romano cheese
